Career

Historical

Summary

Biography

Career Statistics

Career

Games/Starts: 35/12

Colgate Debut: Sept. 9, 2017, vs. Richmond

First Career Start: April 3, 2021, at Fordham

Stats Through End of 2020-21: 95 tackles, including 50 solo; 9 tackles-for-loss, accounting for minus-27 yards; Two sacks for minus-14; Four pass breakups; One forced fumble: One interception

Awards

Two-Time Patriot League Academic Honor Roll

Two-Time Colgate Raider Academic Honor Roll

2021 (Super Senior)

Played and started 11 games

59 total tackles including 34 solo, 4.0 tackles for loss totaling minus-15 yards, a sack for minus-8 yards, three passes broken up, an interception and a quarterback hurry

Tied for second on the team in solo tackles and tackles for loss, third on the team in total tackles

Career-high nine tackles (three solo), an 8-yard sack and a pass break-up at Patriot League champion Holy Cross

Eight tackles including four solo stops versus William & Mary

Twice registered seven tackles (each time four solo and a TFL) ; in the season opener against FBS foe Boston College and in the win over Lehigh

Three solos and three assists in 20-13 win over Lafayette

Five tackles with four solo stops at Brown

Four tackles against Stony Brook (three solo) and at Cornell (one solo) with a pass break-up

Three tackles with two solo stops including one for loss against Bucknell

Three solo stops and a pass broken-up at Georgetown

In the season finale against Fordham racked up three solo stops and his only career interception

2020-21 (Senior)

Played two games, starting one

Six tackles, including three solo, one pass breakup..

Five tackles (two solo) in opener at Lafayette

Made first career start and posted one solo stop along with one pass breakup at Fordham

Season moved to spring and team played two-game schedule because of Covid-19 Pandemic.

2019 (Junior)

Played in 10 games

Seven tackles, including two solo, one shared tackle-for-loss for minus-1 yard..

Three tackles (one solo) at Air Force

Solo stop at Dartmouth

Single tackles also against Villanova, William & Mary and Maine.

2018 (Sophomore)

Played in two games

Four tackles, including two solo.

Three tackles in opening 24-17 win against Holy Cross

Played in first two games before missing remainder of season because of injury.

2017 (First Year)

Played in 10 games

19 tackles, including eight solo, one sack for minus-6 and one forced fumble.

Tied for fourth on team with 4½ tackles-for-loss, accounting for minus-11 yards

Season-high three tackles against both Furman and Cornell

At least one tackle in all 10 games played

First career sack for minus-6 and one additional TFL in 21-7 victory at Cornell

1.5 TFLs against Furman and one TFL in Patriot League title clincher at Georgetown

Forced fumble against Furman

Before Colgate

Shawnee Mission East High School ... Two-year letterman and senior-year captain ... Played first two high school seasons at Bishop Miege.

Position: DB/WR

Stats: Helped lead Bishop Miege to a 2014 state championship and SM East to a 2016 Sunflower League championship … During his tenure, teams combined for a 41-6 record … Finished his defensive career with 163 tackles and six interceptions … Notched 1,011 receiving yards and 14 receiving touchdowns, 545 rushing yards and eight rushing TDs … Notched 66 tackles, 14 pass breakups and two interceptions during his senior season alone … Ran for 128 yards and two touchdowns during his final campaign, while also registering 794 receiving yards and 11 touchdowns.

Honors: Selected as a 2017 Kansas Shrine Bowl participant at both DB and WR … Garnered Class 6A All-State and All-Simone Team for Kansas City metro area … Took home USA Today All-State defensive back honors and nominated for the Otis Taylor Award as top wide receiver in the city … 2016 Sunflower League Player of the Year ... Two-time All-Sunflower League defensive back and also 2016 honoree at wide receiver ... 2014 All-Eastern Kansas League at defensive back … Earned Kansas Elite 11 accolades as senior.

Get to Know: Also lettered in baseball and basketball … Member of National Honor Society.

Personal

Born: Trevor James Thompson in Kansas City, Missouri.

Family: Parents are Brent and Pam Thompson … Has one sister.

No stats available for the current season.
